metadata.title: USN-5605-1 -- Linux kernel (Azure CVM) vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Asaf Modelevsky discovered that the Intel(R) 10GbE PCI Express (ixgbe) Ethernet driver for the Linux kernel performed insufficient control flow management. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2021-33061)  It was discovered that the virtual terminal driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle VGA console font changes, leading to an out-of-bounds write. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-33656)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5605-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-5.4.0-1090-azure-fde - 5.4.0-1090.95+cvm1.1 linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1090-azure-fde - 5.4.0-1090.95+cvm1.1 No subscription required  linux-azure-fde - 5.4.0.1090.95+cvm1.30 linux-modules-extra-azure-fde - 5.4.0.1090.95+cvm1.30 linux-image-azure-fde - 5.4.0.1090.95+cvm1.30 linux-cloud-tools-azure-fde - 5.4.0.1090.95+cvm1.30 linux-tools-azure-fde - 5.4.0.1090.95+cvm1.30 linux-headers-azure-fde - 5.4.0.1090.95+cvm1.30 No subscription required
